Has anyone had any success with play by post?
<div id='comment z130xfpais2cxpfi404cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101136003330765019703_photo.jpg'> Russell Engel</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-09 15:29:55 (edited: 2017-05-09 15:29:55)</cite></p>
        <p>I have had many successes of play by post using google documents. But I have also had some groups that we start out strong and then die quickly. It all depends on makeup of group.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z130xfpais2cxpfi404cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/113927217394445366066_photo.jpg'> Marshall Miller</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-09 15:30:33 (edited: 2017-05-09 15:30:33)</cite></p>
        <p>Yes. DW is perfect for play by post.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z130xfpais2cxpfi404cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110301622772119888974_photo.jpg'> Andrew Huffaker</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-09 15:38:00 (edited: 2017-05-09 15:38:00)</cite></p>
        <p>Can any one direct me towards examples or give a primer of how you manage it?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z130xfpais2cxpfi404cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110301622772119888974_photo.jpg'> Andrew Huffaker</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-09 15:38:36 (edited: 2017-05-09 15:38:36)</cite></p>
        <p>Can any one direct me towards examples or give a primer of how you manage it?</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z130xfpais2cxpfi404cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101136003330765019703_photo.jpg'> Russell Engel</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-09 15:40:12 (edited: 2017-05-09 15:40:12)</cite></p>
        <p>Most groups have a requirement that you post either once a day or once a week. some are more frequent.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z130xfpais2cxpfi404cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>

<div id='comment z130xfpais2cxpfi404cftxpikirjhdp5mw0k'>

      <p><cite>2017-05-09 16:49:54 (edited: 2017-05-09 16:49:54)</cite></p>
        <p>I&#39;ve used google+ communities, lets you keep everything in a single place, and neatly organized.</p>
</div>
